identificationModule.briefTitle: A Study of Efficacy and Safety of Ianalumab Versus Placebo in Addition to Eltrombopag in Primary Immune Thrombocytopenia Patients Who Failed Steroids
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Phase 3 Randomized, Double-blind Study of Ianalumab (VAY736) Versus Placebo in Addition to Eltrombopag in Patients With Primary Immune Thrombocytopenia (ITP) Who Had an Insufficient Response or Relapsed After First Line Steroid Treatment (VAYHIT2)

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of two different doses of ianalumab added to eltrombopag to prolong Time to Treatment Failure (TTF) in adults with primary ITP who failed previous first-line treatment with steroids.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
This is a multicenter, randomized, double-blinded phase 3 study to assess efficacy and safety of two different doses of ianalumab versus placebo in addition to eltrombopag in adults with primary ITP (platelet count \<30 G/L) who failed previous first-line treatment with corticosteroids.

After completion of the screening period, the participants will enter the randomized treatment period (ianalumab/placebo with eltrombopag) followed by the eltrombopag tapering period. Afterwards, all participants will enter the follow-up period to be monitored for efficacy and safety or safety only depending on how the participants responded to the study treatment.

armGroups.label: Treatment arm 1
armGroups.description: Participants will receive eltrombopag and ianalumab lower dose

armGroups.label: Treatment arm 2
armGroups.description: Participants will receive eltrombopag and ianalumab higher dose

armGroups.label: Treatment arm 3
armGroups.description: Participants will receive eltrombopag and placebo

interventions.name: Ianalumab
interventions.description: Concentrate for solution for infusion for intravenous use

interventions.name: Placebo
interventions.description: Concentrate for solution for infusion for intravenous use.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Time from randomization until treatment failure
primaryOutcomes.description:
Time from randomization until treatment failure is defined as the time from randomization date until the first of the following events indicative of treatment failure:

* platelet count below 30 G/L
* start of a new ITP treatment
* need for a rescue treatment
* ineligibility to taper or inability to discontinue eltrombopag
* death
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to until end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last participant)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Complete Response rate at each timepoint
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of participants with any platelet count of at least 100 G/L in the absence of rescue treatment or new ITP treatment
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to until end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last participant)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Response rate at each timepoint
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of participants with any platelet count of at least 50 G/L in the absence of rescue treatment or new ITP treatment
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to until end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last participant)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Best response rate across all timepoints
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of participants with a best response rate of either response or complete response
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to until end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last participant)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time to first response/time to first complete response
secondaryOutcomes.description: Time from randomization to date of first response and time from randomization to date of first complete response
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Time from randomization up to the longest observed treatment period duration

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Duration of response
secondaryOutcomes.description: Time from achievement of response to treatment failure Stable response at 6 months
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to until end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last participant)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Stable response at 6 months
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of participants with at least 3 platelet count collected at month 6 between (study days 121 and 183 and at least 75% of platelet counts qualified as a response
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At 6 months

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Stable response at 1 year
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of participants with at least 2 platelet count collected at year 1 between (study days 296 and 379 and at least 66% of platelet counts qualified as a response
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: At 1 year

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Duration of complete response
secondaryOutcomes.description: Time from achievement of complete response to loss of complete response stable response at 1 year period
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last participant)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Rate of participants who successfully taper and discontinue eltrombopag in each treatment arm
secondaryOutcomes.description: Probability to be treatment failure-free (as defined for the primary efficacy endpoint)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to week 24

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of participants with bleeding events according to World Health Organization (WHO)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of participants reporting bleeding events according to WHO bleeding scale
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to until end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last participant)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of participants receiving rescue treatment
secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of participants who are in need of rescue treatment in each treatment arm
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to until end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last participant)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Percentage of participants receiving rescue treatment
secondaryOutcomes.description: Percentage of participants who are in need of rescue treatment
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to until end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last participant)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline in the frequency of CD19+ B-cell counts
secondaryOutcomes.description: Post-baseline frequency of CD19+ B-cell counts (percentage within CD45) compared to baseline
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to until end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last participant)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline in the absolute number of CD19+ B-cell counts
secondaryOutcomes.description: Post-baseline absolute number of CD19+ B-cell counts compared to baseline
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to until end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last participant)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline on T-score of the PROMIS SF v1.0 Fatigue 13a
secondaryOutcomes.description: The Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Short Form v1.0 Fatigue 13a includes 13 items that assess fatigue in adults.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From screening (baseline) until end of study (up 39 months after randomization of last participant)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline in ITP PAQ domain scores of symptoms, fatigue, bother (uncomfortable), activity
secondaryOutcomes.description: The ITP-PAQ is a 44 item scale for measuring HRQoL in adults with ITP across ten scales: Symptoms, Bother-Physical Health, Fatigue/Sleep, Activity, Fear, Psychological Health, Work, Social Activity, Women´s Reproductive Health, overall QoL. Each item is rated on a Likert type scale. Each scale is scored from 0 to 100. Higher scores represent better HRQoL.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: From screening (baseline) until end of study (up 39 months after randomization of last participant)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Time to first occurence of B-cell recovery defined as ≥80% of baseline ≥50 cells/µL
secondaryOutcomes.description: Time to B-cell recovery defined as ≥80% of baseline or ≥50 cells/µL
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to until end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last participant)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change from baseline in immunoglobulins
secondaryOutcomes.description: Change from baseline in immunoglobulin levels
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Randomization to until end of study (up to 39 months after randomization of last participant)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: PK parameters: AUClast
secondaryOutcomes.description: AUClast: Area under the curve from time zero to the last measurable concentration sampling time (tlast)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: After first dose (pre-dose, 2, 168, 336 and 504 hours post dose) and after last dose (pre-dose, 2, 336, 672, 1344, 2016, 3360 hours post dose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: PK parameters: AUCtau
secondaryOutcomes.description: AUCtau: Area under the curve calculated to the end of a dosing interval (tau)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: After first dose (pre-dose, 2, 168, 336 and 504 hours post dose) and after last dose (pre-dose, 2, 336, 672, 1344, 2016, 3360 hours post dose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: PK parameters: Cmax
secondaryOutcomes.description: Maximum (peak) observed plasma, blood, serum or other body fluid drug concentration
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: After first dose (pre-dose, 2, 168, 336 and 504 hours post dose) and after last dose (pre-dose, 2, 336, 672, 1344, 2016, 3360 hours post dose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: PK parameters: Tmax
secondaryOutcomes.description: Time to reach maximum (peak) observed plasma, blood, serum or other body fluid drug concentration
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: After first dose (pre-dose, 2, 168, 336 and 504 hours post dose) and after last dose (pre-dose, 2, 336, 672, 1344, 2016, 3360 hours post dose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: PK parameters: Accumulation ratio Racc
secondaryOutcomes.description: Accumulation ratio calculated using AUC values obtained after the last and first dose
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: After last dose (pre-dose, 2, 336, 672, 1344, 2016, 3360 hours post dose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Incidence of anti-ianalumab antibodies in serum (ADA assay) over time
secondaryOutcomes.description: Anti-drug antibodies (ADA) will be evaluated in samples collected from all participants assessing the immunogenicity of ianalumab
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to week 33

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Titer of anti-ianalumab antibodies in serum (ADA assay) over time
secondaryOutcomes.description: Anti-drug antibodies (ADA) will be evaluated in samples collected from all participants assessing the immunogenicity of ianalumab
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: up to week 33

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Key Inclusion criteria

1. Male or female patients aged 18 years and older on the day of signing the informed consent.
2. A signed informed consent must be obtained prior to participation in the study.
3. A diagnosis of primary ITP, with insufficient response to, or relapse after a first-line corticosteroid therapy ± IVIG.
4. Patient with platelet count \<30G/L (whom eltrombopag is clinically indicated as per physician's discretion) and with no contraindication to receive eltrombopag

Key Exclusion criteria

1. ITP patients who received second-line ITP treatments (other than steroid therapy± IVIG) including splenectomy. However, patients exposed to thrombopoietin receptor agonists (TPO-RAs) for a limited time (max one week) before screening are eligible.
2. Patients with key lab abnormalities and patients with Evans syndrome or any other cytopenia, (patients with low grade anemia related to bleeding or iron deficiency are eligible).
3. Patients with history of clinically significant hematological disorders, or with marked altered hematologic parameters
4. Patients with current or history of life-threatening bleeding
5. Patient that are Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV), Hepatitis C Virus (HCV), Hepatitis B surface Antigen (HBsAg)/ Hepatitis B core antibody (HBcAb)-positive. HBcAb-positive patients can be enrolled if HBsAg negative, HBV DNA negative, no pre-existing liver fibrosis is present and antiviral prophylaxis is given
6. Patients with known active or uncontrolled infection requiring systemic treatment during screening period
7. Patients with hepatic impairment
8. Patients with concurrent coagulation disorders and/or receiving antiplatelet or anticoagulant medication with an exemption of low dose of acetylsalicylic acid (≤150 mg daily)
9. Female patients who are pregnant or nursing

Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply.

ipdSharingStatementModule.description:
Novartis is committed to sharing with qualified external researchers, access to patient-level data and supporting clinical documents from eligible studies. These requests are reviewed and approved by an independent review panel on the basis of scientific merit. All data provided is anonymized to respect the privacy of patients who have participated in the trial in line with applicable laws and regulations.

This trial data availability is according to the criteria and process described on www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com
